title: Is it possible to use the front and rear camera at the same time? - Quora

response.answer_text: On a Smart-phone? If the phone doesn't already come with that feature in its camera department, although the chances are slim, there may be 3rd party camera application you could download and install to get it to work that way. A smart-phone's hardware is usually the bottleneck for that to become a possibility. Either it is short on RAM or processing power or both in order to handle image / video data from both cameras at the same time. Then comes the software restrictions which stops you from using both cameras at the same time because of the above mentioned reason. Also, if you are expecting that feature to be available on a lower end Smart-phone, there is another thing to consider; its price point. If the phone makers offer such a feature on their budget phones, they will be have one less “new” feature to market their higher end smartphones with.

Yes, if your phone has multiple screen features which is also called split screen features, where you can use multiple apps at same time on single screen. You just have to open front camera and rear camera on both the split screen. And may be there are many applications are present at Google Play but I am not sure about that.
